scheme_data.schemeName: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Scholarship-Free Education upto 12th Std. to All
scheme_data.shortDescription: {"id": "4zKfPpIBISXYddfJ1ZnO", "fields": {"beneficiaryState": ["Tamil Nadu"], "schemeShortTitle": "ADTWSFE", "level": "State", "nodalMinistryName": null, "schemeCategory": ["Education & Learning"], "schemeName": "Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Scholarship-Free Education upto 12th Std. to All", "schemeCloseDate": null, "slug": "adtwsfe", "briefDescription": "This scheme provides free education for Adi Dravidar, Tribal and Adi Dravidar (Converted to Christianity) students up to 12th standard, covering tuition fees, which are reimbursed by the government.\n", "age": {"st": {"gte": 4, "lte": 18}}, "tags": ["Tribal Welfare", "Adi Dravidar", "Free Education", "Scholarship"]}, "highlight": {}}
scheme_data.description:
The name of this welfare scheme is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Scholarship-Free Education upto 12th Std. to All. It is also known as ADTWSFE. The scheme “Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Scholarship-Free Education upto 12th Std. to All” by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, is designed to support students from Adi Dravidar, Tribal, and Adi Dravidar Converted to Christianity communities by offering free education up to the 12th standard. The tuition fees for eligible students are waived, and the government reimburses the amount, ensuring financial barriers do not hinder access to education.
<br> The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Tamil Nadu. Additionally, the nodal department is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Reimbursement: Full reimbursement of tuition fees for students up to the 12th standard.

Eligibility criteria include: The beneficiary should be a Student.
  The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu.
  The beneficiary should belong to the Adi Dravidar/Tribal/Adi Dravidar converted to Christianity community.
  The beneficiary must be enrolled in a school up to the 12th standard. The application process is as follows: Students/ Guardians should contact the Headmaster of the School with all the required documents as directed by the authority. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.tn.gov.in/scheme/data_view/83084 Tags associated with the scheme include: Adi Dravidar, Free Education, Scholarship, Tribal Welfare.

to All.
It is also known as ADTWSFE.
The scheme “Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Scholarship-Free Education upto 12th Std.

to All” by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, is designed to support students from Adi Dravidar, Tribal, and Adi Dravidar Converted to Christianity communities by offering free education up to the 12th standard.
The tuition fees for eligible students are waived, and the government reimburses the amount, ensuring financial barriers do not hinder access to education.

It is specifically implemented in Tamil Nadu.
Additionally, the nodal department is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department.

The beneficiary should belong to the Adi Dravidar/Tribal/Adi Dravidar converted to Christianity community.
The beneficiary must be enrolled in a school up to the 12th standard.
The application process is as follows: Students/ Guardians should contact the Headmaster of the School with all the required documents as directed by the authority.

ctus.text: The name of this welfare scheme is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Scholarship-Free Education upto 12th Std. to All. It is also known as ADTWSFE. The scheme “Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Scholarship-Free Education upto 12th Std.

to All” by the Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department, Tamil Nadu, is designed to support students from Adi Dravidar, Tribal, and Adi Dravidar Converted to Christianity communities by offering free education up to the 12th standard. The tuition fees for eligible students are waived, and the government reimburses the amount, ensuring financial barriers do not hinder access to education. <br> The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Tamil Nadu.

Additionally, the nodal department is Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department. The scheme provides the following benefits: Reimbursement: Full reimbursement of tuition fees for students up to the 12th standard. Eligibility criteria include: The beneficiary should be a Student. The beneficiary should be a resident of Tamil Nadu.

The beneficiary should belong to the Adi Dravidar/Tribal/Adi Dravidar converted to Christianity community. The beneficiary must be enrolled in a school up to the 12th standard. The application process is as follows: Students/ Guardians should contact the Headmaster of the School with all the required documents as directed by the authority. For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.
